qas.question: Which country had a flag in 1977 that was only green?
What does the green in Jamaica's flag represent?
What does the green cedar of Lebanon tree represent on the Flag of Lebanon?
Which color is considered sacred in Islam?
When was the flag of Hamas created?

plausible_answers.text: one color and no design, insignia, or other details

qas.question: Iran is the only flag in the world with just what?
How many colors does the flag of Iran have?
The Jamaican flag represents hope using what color?
What religion does Lebanon's flag represent?

context: Many flags of the Islamic world are <a3_0>green<a3_0/>, as the color is considered sacred in <b8_0>Islam<b8_0/> (see below). The flag of Hamas, as well as the flag of Iran, is green, symbolizing their Islamist ideology. The <b4_0>1977<b4_0/> flag of <a0_0>Libya<a0_0/> consisted of a simple green field with no other characteristics. It was the only national flag in the world with just <b5_0><b6_0>one<b6_0/> color and no design, insignia, or other details<b5_0/>. Some countries used <b7_0>green<b7_0/> in their flags to represent their <a1_0>country's lush vegetation<a1_0/>, as in the flag of Jamaica, and hope in the future, as in the flags of Portugal and Nigeria. The green cedar of Lebanon tree on the Flag of Lebanon officially represents <a2_0>steadiness and tolerance<a2_0/>.
